basics.name: Galileo Daras
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.phone: Contact me for my phone number
basics.summary: Passionate about programming, with 5+ years of programming experience in various fields and languages. Strives for code quality to support collaboration amongst peers/co-workers. Extensive experience with Java, Ruby, Golang, and server resource management. Always eager take on an interesting challenge or learn new ways to write better code.

work.summary: Co-captain of the programming sub-team on the Bot Provoking FRC robotics team. Lead other students and taught programming courses to new team members, set up a program for outreach to help other teams who don't have the same skills.
highlights: Developed open-source real-world path generation library (Java)

work.summary: Built data aggregation tools (crawlers) to improve content accessibility. Began development on ground-up rebuild of site.
highlights: Created reverse engineered and created documentation for Netflix API
Leaded development on rebuild of site

work.summary: Created a Home Automation/Internet of Things platform with hardware (microcontroller) and software components.
highlights: State-of-the-art technology for indoor localization (Using WiFi CSI)
Android app with custom extensible and secure plugin framework

work.summary: Worked on developing technologies for instantaneous targeted contact sharing on Android and developing CMS and project management tools to manage all facets of the backend.

volunteer.summary: Taught a course for middle schoolers on advanced computer science concepts, beginning with object oriented programming and touching upon functional programming, algorithmic complexity, and Android app development.

awards.title: Caroline D. Bradley Scholarship
awards.summary: Selected for full scholarship to attend any school based solely on academic merit.

awards.title: Best Overall App (1st place)
awards.summary: Built a working prototype for crowd-sourcing train location in less than 24 hours. By the end, had a Raspberry Pi running beacon software written in Ruby, and an Android app.
